org.daisy.common.messaging

Class MessageBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.common.messaging.MessageAccessor
      • org.daisy.common.messaging.AbstractMessageAccessor
        • org.daisy.common.messaging.MessageBus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageAppender

    public class MessageBus
extends AbstractMessageAccessor
implements MessageAppender
    Collection of messages that belong together, for example to a Pipeline job.

        public MessageBus(String ownerId,
                  Message.Level threshold)
        Parameters:
        ownerId - A string that uniquely identifies this collection of messages. Could for instance be the ID of a Pipeline job.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: MessageAppender
        Close the underlying message. If a message is closed, the progress becomes 1 and no child message can be appended.
        Specified by:
        close in interface MessageAppender

      • allMessages

        protected Iterable<Message> allMessages()
        Description copied from class: AbstractMessageAccessor
        Must return a (mutable) iterable that contains all messages (which are mutable) received up till now. Mutating operations on the iterable must be synchronized on the object itself.
        Specified by:
        allMessages in class AbstractMessageAccessor

      • listen

        public void listen(Consumer<Integer> callback)
        Description copied from class: MessageAccessor
        Register a callback that is called whenever a new (top-level) message arrives, a message is updated with descendant messages, or the progress of a message changes. The argument must be a function that accepts a sequence number representing the event. This sequence number can then be used to get the list of all messages affected by the change, via createFilter().inRange(...).getMessages(). A sequence number is never null and never lower than the sequence numbers previously received, but the same sequence number may occur more than once.
        Specified by:
        listen in class MessageAccessor

      • unlisten

        public void unlisten(Consumer<Integer> callback)
        Specified by:
        unlisten in class MessageAccessor
